ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Gram Jyoti is dedicated to the development and empowerment of vulnerable groups and especially rural and oppress families through grass root action, research and awareness generation since 1998. It has rich experienced on project operation, management and its execution in sustainable agriculture, NRM, saving & credit, Water and Sanitation Development , child protection and women development program in Santhal Pargana region. Itsâ€™ credit has so many prestigious work in the area of water and sanitation program and awarded by the Honourable president of India under Nirmal Gram Purushkar, Jal Star award by the Danik Bhashkar print media on water conservation measure as well as local administration of Deoghar district on sanitation action. Apart from this, water aid india awarded to the Gram Jyoti as a best partners in east region of india. Core cut strategy of Gram Jyoti is Village level people institution like SHG/ Kissan Sabha/ Kissan Club/ VWSC to cater any development plan at ground level. â€¢ Ensured food security for 1200 Households throughout the year benefiting from social security and livelihood schemes and enhanced production in agriculture and allied sectors. â€¢ 55 acres of barren land was transferred for orchard development (Mango, Lemon, Guava, Jackfruit, Papaya, and Pomegranate) through which 100 farming families benefited. â€¢ 1 Lakh timber saplings distributed among 5000 families as part of family insurance â€¢ 52 nos. irrigation wells were constructed for promotion of irrigation. â€¢ 62 nos. of hand pumps installed and 189 H.P restoration done and community mobilized for its operation and maintenance. â€¢ Hand washing facilities constructed and in use with Force and Lift Pumps in 17 schools. â€¢ 12 families benefited through wormy compost production. â€¢ 138 Women SHGs formed and promoted â€¢ 70 Kisan Club formed and promoted â€¢ 26 Child Club (Bal Sansad) formed and promoted â€¢ 27 Adolescents groups formed and promoted â€¢ 6 water recharge tank has been constructed benefiting 272 tribal families. â€¢ 26 Roof top rain water preserver constructed in schools & community level for domestic use and water recharge â€¢ 204Village water and sanitation committees are functional at village level. â€¢ 49 villages have attained open defection free status. â€¢ 4855 families are accessing safe drinking water â€¢ 8564 low cost toilets are constructed of different model and are in use. â€¢ 25 PWDs friendly toilets have been constructed and 8 IHHL have been made PWDs friendly. â€¢ 83 school sanitary blocks have been constructed. â€¢ 3 information center at panchayat level are functioning â€¢ Training Module developed to impart training to the â€œJal Sahiyaâ€ â€¢ 700 Jal Sahiyas trained in 3 district i.e Deoghar, Dumka, Pakur of Jharkhand state. â€¢ 469 masons have been trained with technical and practical knowledge on NBA toilet model and 56 master trainers have been trained with technical and practical knowledge on NBA toilet model. â€¢ Developed 2 model WASH park for demonstration of the rural people at Deoghar and Pakur District. â€¢ 2 Mini water supply scheme have been Installed at Chulhiya and Konkribank villages. â€¢ Nirmal Gram Panchayat Prushkar awarded to Thariyara & Postwari Pachayats of Mohanpur Block of Deoghar District.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Gramin Vikas Parishad (GVP) is primarily working on community based sustainable livelihood and natural resource management issues in Degohar and Dumka districts of Jharkhand and Banka district of Bihar state, with particular focus on socio-economic disadvantaged communities. Environment and gender have been cross cutting themes of GVP interventions. The organization is backed up by a committed team of social workers, professionals with good knowledge and understanding of local issues, led by Mr. J. B. Ram, ex-divisional forest officer of this region. Mr. Ram had been in Forest Department Services till 1985 and after retirement he established the organization to promote environmental protection and conservation activities in Bihar and Jharkhand. He had been member of National Standing Committee of CAPART for 7 years period, and associated with Ministry of Rural Development as Monitor and Evaluator of NGO activities & Integrated Wasteland Development Programmes of Govt. in the states Bihar, Jharkhand, Orissa, West Bengal and Sikkim. Major areas of organizational intervention includes social forestry, watershed and wasteland management, bio-diversity conservation and livelihood promotion by strengthening linkages and capacities of disadvantaged communities for optimum utilization of locally available resources. The organization is working for revival of traditional tribal culture and issues directly influencing the tribal people viz. traditional self governance, food security, self identity and opportunities for a dignified living. To ensure active participation of the communities and enhance their programmatic abilities and decision making, the organization has initiated social mobilization through promotion of community based organization, awareness and education activities and capacity building which has culminated into practice of social fencing at some of the locations. To promote the access to and control over resources the organization has also laid stress on group mobilization efforts for women and other vulnerable sections of the society. So far the organization has been able to encourage masses to promote plantation activities in more than 2000 Ha of private as well as community lands. With its incessant efforts to retain the vegetative coverage and soil and water conservation in community based approach the organization has also received two coveted national awards viz. Indira Priyadarshini Vrikshamitra Award in the year 1993 and Rajiv Gandhi Partibhumi Mitra Award in the year 1994-96.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Green Foundation is working for promotion of national integration and nation building work through its diverse programmes and activities particularly through intellectual meet, seminars on relevant subjects. The society is engaged in organising centenary celebrations programmes of important personalities and the events aims to carry forward their contribution to the present generations. The society also regularly organises developmental activities and awareness generation programmes on important subjects like human rights and Right to Information and sustainable development. The society is consistently engaged in celebrating and oraganising activities and programmes on the rich and diverse cultural heritage of the country promoting secularism, communal harmony and strengthening national integration. The society undertakes programmes and activities for the empowerment of women and for the welfare of children, Dalit and minorities and other socially excluded classes in the society. Other important activities of the society are commitments in realm of education, besides, public health, protection of environment and the society is engaged in holding seminars and workshops, group discussions and awareness campaigns and through its various programmes tries to bridge gaps between diverse groups and cultures. It endeavours to arouse and educate public opinion on important issues of human concerns and bases its programmes along similar lines in order to bring changes in society along direction of peace and development, a prime requisite for building a better nation and realisation of dreams of our freedom fighters who bequeathed to us a secular, democratic and independent India.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Genesis: Late Mr. Binoy Kumar singh who was retired Sergeant from Indian Air force struggling with the hilly, and barren land provided by the govt. and trying his best to bring that into agric able and cultivable. During that time he and his wife Late Mrs. Janki singh were also initiated social work for the betterment of the under privilege classes in the area especially the women and children. His strenuous toil transformed the barren land to a fertile one. He taught the people how to cultivate crops by using the technique of biological farming. He was a great environmentalist and social activist. He started the Chipko Movement against the contractors and saved the forest of Chechali and Jitpur. By his effort, the awareness among the people to save the environment got a new dimension. He was not merely a farmer but also an architect who contributed towards the moral development of human being. People had great respect for him. We built well knit village organizations in 50 Villages of our working area. Each village is a unit, its people decide to work to resolve their basic need. The work is done by all for all as partners and organized as cadres to fulfil different functions of the whole. There is no discrimination based on gender, caste or wealth. It is true that there may be different levels of involvements: but the underlying spirit is that all are partners, and so one is a subordinate of another. Also, nothing great can be achieved without volunteers who are committed to regular participation and are properly organized. Individuals working in isolation are not enough to build a well knit village organization. Due to the functional structure and regular community based actions. We have archived the following i.e. Elimination of intoxication, Reduction in Domestic Violence on women, Reduction in Communal caste based discrimination, Reduction in Dowry and Divorce, Built an pro active environment for women and hiding girls to enjoy dignified modern life, Enhanced Leadership capacity to access the services, Created opportunities for the early school leaver youth to regain vocational skills to live with job to accelerate their quality of life.
